name: unburnable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If something is unburnable, it is not possible to burn it, or people do not want to burn it, for example, for environmental reasons: There's a system for sorting household waste into paper, stuff for the compost bin, and unburnable stuff such as tin. The majority of fossil fuel reserves are unburnable if the world is to avoid dangerous climate change.
More examplesFewer examplesThe hut had a floor consisting only of unburnable wet muck.The report suggests that if carbon capture and storage technology can be refined, it will enable the world to use more of its unburnable carbon.It is likely that over 90% of Australian coal reserves are unburnable under even the most generous carbon budget.
